As for location, a small 5 minute walk and you were in the hub of all the attractions. I would definately recommend this hotel to my friends. Thank Alvin for such a Nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “For comfort, convenience, and cleanliness this is a real find.”
Reviews.Author: Academyaward
Reviews.Content: As I just refused to have to spend $250-$400. per night for a business meeting I was paying for I located this hotel on the internet. Was very skeptical about the description and the reviews. Was even afraid to give them my credit card number on the phone to hold my room. B U T I couldn't have been more pleased with this little jewel. NIce NIce staff, clean, clean, clean, comfortable bedding. Safe. Couldn't stay with friends this time in LA and if that ever happens again I won't hesitate to stay here another time. Excellent location too. And, this entire review is factual from my point of view.

Reviews.Title: “Good value in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Keti73
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for three nights during the weekend and I have nothing bad to say about it. For a tourist or first time visitor the location is great, just behind Kodak Theatre in a quiet cul-de-sac so you don't hear any traffic or noise eventhough you are just off Hollywood Boulevard. It is literally minutes walk from HB where all the tour buses stop. The hotel is nothing spectacular and slightly tacky as far as decor goes but I kinda liked that. The room was huge, I travelled around California for almost a month and this is the largest room I stayed in. They offer free wi-fi in each room and also off street parking free of charge. Also included in the price was breakfast which was very basic (tea/coffee/juice and croissants/toast) but enough to help you start the day. They have a little seating area with few tables and chairs at the front entrance which was nice to use during breakfast or in the evening before retiring to your room. I would definitely stay there again. I think for the price this is probably as good as it gets. There are a couple of other hotels on this same little road and they all looked fairly decent from the outside.

Reviews.Title: “Great Base for Sightseeing with Everything You Need”
Reviews.Author: lancshiker2308
Reviews.Content: This was a bit of a find actually. We were struggling to find a decent hotel in LA that was reasonably priced and near the main attractions. This is definitely it. The front desk staff were helpful, booking tickets and tours for us. There's no lift for those with heavy cases but there are only two floors. The car park can get busy but if your car gets blocked in, the staff will move the other cars out of the way for you. The room was clean, with good facilities and it was fairly quiet. You can hear traffic going past the window but it's not too intrusive. If you're a light sleeper though, take some earplugs. They do provide a continental breakfast but it's probably not worth the bother. The croissants were like window leathers left out in the sun too long and you have to fight your way through hoards of people to get near the toaster. Beware the eight slices at a time toaster monopolisers. These people are a menace at breakfast buffets and seem on a mission to grab as much stuff as they possibly can because they are locked in a cupboard without food or light when they're not on holiday. This hotel is great though and round the corner from all the attractions Hollywood has to offer. The prices are very reasonable as well.

Reviews.Title: “great value”
Reviews.Author: polishmisia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights at the end of May. The room is very basic but big, we didn;t spend much time in the hotel anyway so it was ok. the parking lot is very tight and at night cars have to park in the middle of the parking lot causing them to block other cars but the front desk moves the other cars if they block your car. i didnt think that the breakfast was very good, no meat, no eggs and no cereal which i think is something that they could have provided. our first night we had the luck of staying next door to some very loud people who went clubbing and returned home at 3am and didnt quite down for a few hours. basically the walls are very thin so you hear everything. overall i would stay here again as the price is great and the rooms big and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: turnipblade
Reviews.Content: The hotel is conveniently located behind the Hollywood and Highland Mall, in the middle of all the tourist attractions on the Walk of Fame, also accesible via the LA Metro Service, My room was clean and quiet, and the complimentary internet and breakfast were great. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, very basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Schumi5
Reviews.Content: Locations was pretty good. Room clean but a bit of a bleach odor in the room. Its a very basic hotel and cant expect much for the rates that are charged. Walking distance to the Hollywood Walk of fame, restaurants, sites etc etc

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: Catherine D
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in May 2011. This was our second time staying at this hotel and chose it again because of the friendly staff, convenient location and easy walking distance to Hollywood Boulevard and a short train ride away from Universal Studios. (We only discovered this by asking the staff). One staff member even remembered us from our stay last year! The rooms are clean and comfortable and a free breakfast is provided every morning - pastries, toast and muffins, yohgurt, juices, tea and coffee, which is more than adequate to provide a great start to your day. We arrived early after a long plane trip and were able to check in straight away which is something that is not found in some large hotels. My husband and I both agree that this hotel has a friendly atmosphere that you don't find very often and would highly recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: jwalsh33
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights. Good location, walking distance to Hollywood Walk of Fame and Kodak Theatre. Hotel itself felt a bit dated, no elevator to second floor. Rooms were a good size, just a little bit lacklustre. Wifi didn't work properly the weekend we were there, to be fair they were waiting for an engineer to come and fix it the day we left Staff were friendly and helpful Free car park If you are in LA you will probably be using a car a lot anyway, so would suggest it's worth looking for a budget hotel nearby, and just drive into this area if you want to visit

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: lg926
Reviews.Content: I didnt know what to expect but I was pleasantly surprised. My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights and I don't think there is a better deal around! The location is great and you can walk to the hollywood bowl or the walk of fame. Parking is limited but it is free and they are accommodating. The last night we came back from dinner and there were no spots so they let us leave our keys at the desk and moved our car when a spot came available. If you are on a budget the free breakfast is great. Its no frills for sure but was sufficient to fill me up and save money. I would recommend this hotel to my friends and consider staying here on my next trip to the hollywood area.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: harsharangachar
Reviews.Content: I was in the Hollywood/LA area for a week on vacation, and being completely new to the area, I was more than pleasantly suprised to discover the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. You couldn't ask for a better location- being just three minutes away from Hollywood Blvd , and such attractions as the Kodak Theatre and Graumans Chinese Theatre. The prices are very decent. And it is so centrally located, yet on a quiet lane away from all the noise and traffic. You couldnt ask for a better place!! The staff is extremely courteous and friendly and will do anything to make your stay comfortable. I will definitely be staying at this hotel for all my trips to LA in the future, and I would highly recommend it to anyone staying in the Hollywood/LA area!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: yansnit
Reviews.Content: Hollywood celebrity hotel located in a great place in Hollywood - right behind Kodak theater. Even though it is an old building, the room was very clean. The service was great. Rooms prices very reasonable for the location. Add to that a free continental breakfast and the place was great. The only downside is the parking lot is small and the only way to get out of parking is to drive in reverse on the road, so some people may need a second person to help them. And did I say free internet? Each room had a network cable. My friend also tried wireless connection and said it worked great. We were with another couple of friends and we all agreed then next time we are in Hollywood, we will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “So close”
Reviews.Author: JudySydney
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very close to what we needed for a quick look at Hollywood and a day at Universal Studios. Only drawback was there is no elvator. I hadn't realised this and our room was upstairs. We arrived after 5 so there was no-one who could help us upstairs with our luggage. As my daughter and I have bad backs we ended up paying more and stayed in a suite downstairs though still quite a few stairs to contend with. Other than that it was very close to Hollywood and Highland Metro station, short walk through shopping centre at Kodak theatre to Orchid St. Room was clean and we had a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Hazel088
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic, dont expect any frills, but it is so comfortable, great size rooms, very comfortable beds and bathrooms, kitchette areas. Free internet access great bonus. Very friendly and helpful staff. Breakfast is basic but plentiful, ideal really. It is $55 to LAX airport one way for taxi, shuttle is $15 per person. The hotel is a fab location just 5 minute walk to hollywood walk of fame, you can see the Hollywood sign within 2 minutes walk. There are fast food places (subway, mcdonalds very close), best restaurant California pizza place (great food reasonable prices, 5 mins walk from hotel) avoid Hard Rock Cafe. The hotel is slightly tucked away on no through road, so quiet yet located in the middle of things. Very highly recommend this hotel for any LA trip (Brits..you wont be disappointed). Reiterate, its a no frills hotel, but so comfortable and ideally located.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if in Los Angeles!”
Reviews.Author: gamba250
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed here for 3 nights, and thought it was great. Amazing location... easy access to Hollywood Boulevard destinations like Graumann's Chinese Theater. Also close to Runyon Canyon Park. Helpful staff, continental breakfast (which can be eaten at outside tables), and a microwave/fridge in your room. And the price is right!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service, perfect location excellent spacious accomodation”
Reviews.Author: samspain
Reviews.Content: Only stayed here for 1 night as they were full for our first night but they couldn't do enough for us they rang round and found us somewhere else to stay ( not a patch on this place though) Everyone on the front desk was professional and efficient, the rooms were large and super clean, breakfast very good and it all came at a very reasonable price , you couln't be closer to the sights ( why bother staying at the Radisson next door which is 3 times the price!. It is a small boutique hotel on a small cul-de-sac and it is a 4 min walk to Hollywood boulevard with free parking and a delightful lobby area. I would keep this a secret if I were intending going back to Hollywood but as I am not I would say book early!

Reviews.Title: “perfect location, no frills”
Reviews.Author: moocow8989
Reviews.Content: This place was great the staff were pleasant, however don't go expecting 5 star quality. The room is massive, the hotel did it's job for our trip and we will probably go back

Reviews.Title: “A motel on Hollywood blvd. Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: gary25
Reviews.Content: It's a motel right behind kodak theatre. What more can one ask for. It's clean, simple, no frill, has a 60s feel to it and hs good service. Breakfast is served in the main lobby and can be taken to the room itself. Rooms are decent size as well. All in all, good value for money if you want to see Hollywood attractions but don't want to spend a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Justjcruzn
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in the perfect location, very easy walk to all the tourist activities. The staff were very pleasant. Hotel appears to have recently updated paint and decor. Cute. Room had tables, chairs and small refrig. Our room was clean. Biggest Draw back: NO ELEVATOR - Stairs to even get to Front Door. So with luggage it was a struggle for some.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value for money”
Reviews.Author: Rasmus H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel in connection with the 2011 Academy Awards in Hollywood. The hotel is in fact right behind the Kodak Theatre. Orchid Ave (where the hotel is located) is actually shut down on Oscar Night. Thus, the hotel is very close to all the action on Hollywood Blvd, with Graumann's, all the museums and other attractions in Hollywood right around the corner. It's also a 2-minute walk from The Magic Castle. My room was huge! Apparently I was upgraded so I got a room with two queen beds even though I'm a solo traveller. Aside from the main room, there was a small room with a fridge and a dining table, as well as a medium-size bathroom and a room with plenty of closet space for your clothes. My room was bigger than some of the suites I've stayed in at fancy hotels in Las Vegas. That being said, the room looked very dated and worn out, with bland walls and not much attention paid to interior design or decoration. It's not a place you'd feel comfortable spending a lot of time in. But if you are not planning on spending much time at the hotel anyway, and instead explore the tourist attractions of the area, the Hollywood Celebrity is a good choice for a traveller on a budget. Unlike the room, the halls and the lobby area look very nice. There's also a computer in the lobby for the guests to use. The free Wi-Fi was very slow and unstable. To be fair, the manager offered the use of a LAN connection with a network cable, if you have a laptop. I don't know if that connection was more stable or fast though. A nice feature was a complimentary breakfast. You got some basic choices of toast, croissants, yoghurt and juice. Nothing fancy or delicate by any means, but it was okay considering you didn't pay extra for it (and the room rate is very reasonable to begin with). There is no view to speak of from the room and across the hotel there is often noise from young folks partying and such. This can make it difficult to sleep if it happens while you are staying at the hotel. In terms of amenities, there's all the basic stuff, including a fridge in the room that you can use as you wish, and a TV with all the major channels, including HBO. There was even a microwave oven which is a nice touch. In short, the hotel is great for the location and the price. For a two-star property it exceeded my expectations but it's not a Las Vegas resort by any means and it doesn't try to be.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: mardan91
Reviews.Content: great hotel great location, right outside kodak theater. the rooms are hudge. we had a suite 2 kings with kitchen. the hotel is very quiet, and the staff at reception is incredible helpfull. we will come back for sure. it s a bit far from Santa Monica but that s LA.it is a very spread out city with lots of traffic...it is next to universall studio, one metro station. the bathrooms are nothing special but very clean., after all it is not a 4 star hotel.so don t expect anything too luxury. breakfast was not very good coffee disgusting ( but I am europeen so very demanding on coffee...) you can make your own breakfast in room though.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT VALUE FOR MONEY AND YOU CAN'T BEAT THE LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Jujubaby00
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at this hotel, the first being four years ago. We only stayed one night (to get a good night's sleep after flying from Australia) before driving to Las Vegas. It is a small, no-frills place that ticks all the boxes for a tourist wishing to explore all the usual sightseeing haunts of Hollywood and it is also quite close to Universal Studios. The management are friendly and allowed us to check in early at midday after our long flight. The free breakfast is more than adequate and it even has free parking, which is a huge plus in this area. The wi-fi is free but it does not have a pool. There were two problems encountered this visit. Firstly, a huge group of young people who were staying at the hotel had no consideration for the other guests when they returned in the wee small hours of the morning, laughing and talking very loudly in the common areas. This is difficult for management to control, however extremely annoying. Secondly, I was bitten by bed bugs - I actually felt the bites (2) when I initially got into bed and the bite marks were huge. I know that I definitely did not have any bites on me when I arrived because I showered immediately, then went out for a walk around the sights before hitting the sack for an early night. I know that the US currently has difficulty dealing with the bed bug plague and I hope management have fixed this problem since my visit. If you are on a budget and only want a place to sleep, this may be the place for you, but remember to bring your torch and insect spray.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, close to everything in Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: dave60993
Reviews.Content: Stopped in Los Angeles for two days on our way to Australia. Clean rooms, courteous and helpful staff. Within short walk to Hollywood Blvd. Very reasonable price considering location. Would stay again and will recommend to others. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hollywood experience a family could ask for.”
Reviews.Author: Nadsaym
Reviews.Content: The staff were amazingly friendly and helpful, location is brilliant. I stayed in alot of different accommodation during my three weeks in USA including five star in las Vegas and it's the hollywood celebrity hotel which was my favourite.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: ArtsFactory
Reviews.Content: This was a great find, in the best location and a great and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “BEST SERVICE IN HOLLYWOOD”
Reviews.Author: luv2trav3
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at this hotel until we left, we were blown away by the warm and courteous staff at the reception that make us felt like Hollywood celebrity. They were very accomodating and polite and always provided service with a smile. Best of all, they provided very good tourist information and advice, so much better than the official information booth. Location is unbeatable. Right behind Kodak Theatre, Hollywood and Highland and the Metro station. Easy access to most LA attractions like Universal Studios, Rodeo, Beverley Hills. Comes with free breakfast and all day coffee/tea/hot choc and free wifi and parking . Sure, the hotel is old and dated but very CLEAN and that is most important because you don't come to Hollywood to stay the whole day in the hotel room. Thanks for amazing service!!!

Reviews.Title: “Below average”
Reviews.Author: ioliesym
Reviews.Content: -The bedrooms were spacious but the rug on the floor was kind of disgusting and smelly -The beds were big but the bedsheets were very old -The bathroom was also very old and I was very disgusted - you cant go in there barefoot -It's supposed to be a budget hotel when in fact it was the most expensive hotel we booked during our stay in the USA -The location is good it's right behind the Kodak theatre, but if I were to visit LA again I wouldn't book in that area since it's kind of touristy and at night it's kind of scary to walk around there alone -It offers free parking -It offers coffee in the morning -The lobby is old and kind of smelly

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but small and noisy!”
Reviews.Author: Lick-A-Pringle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel because of its proximity to Hollywood and Highland along with the Metro station. It is nestled away on a dead end street so there isn't a lot of traffic. The facility is a two-story, converted apartment complex. I had a room with a kitchenette which was helpful, especially for extra space and additional wall outlets. The service at the front desk was great, but the breakfast buffet (8 a.m. - 10 a.m.) opened late on both days we were there. The woman who was prepping the breakfast area began setting up at 8:10 and other guests were grabbing things as quickly as they could (bread, bagels, muffins, etc.) The room was clean, but dated. It also had a musty smell. My biggest complaints were the paper-thin walls and the tiny parking area. At about 2 a.m. each night, our neighbors decided it was time to party until around 6 a.m. You can hear everything from the loud music to the talking. I called the front desk and they said they'd take care of it. When that didn't help, I went next door and knocked. There were 6 guys in the room, and one of them was shirtless with shaving cream all over his torso. They kept it down from then on, but you could still hear things. On our first night, four female escorts were leaving the lobby as I was entering. Anyway, just know that this place is for location and not necessarily comfort, peace or quiet. The free parking was helpful, put the parking spaces are tiny. If you drive a truck, mini-van or full-sized vehicle, you'll feel cramped. In fact, one morning we were headed out to Universal Studios after consuming a late breakfast and when we got the our car, we saw that we were blocked in by 4 vehicles. I spoke to the front desk and asked them to move them which they said they'd do. It took about 15 minutes to make that happen. The property is ridiculously close to the Chinese Theater, Kodak Theater, El Capitan, etc. There is a CVS about 1/4 mile away for your food and beer purchases. Not sure I'd stay here again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “An Unexpected Gem, but with Valet-style Parking Issues”
Reviews.Author: CAHeadHunter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at this hotel because of its proximity to the Magic Castle. We were going to be spending an evening at the Magic Castle and wanted a location close enough that we could walk. The hotel is a converted apartment building--Quite cute with HUGE rooms--probably originally studio apartments. The location is great, the hotel is situated directly behind the Kodak theatre and approximately a half a block from the Magic Castle. My husband and I felt comfortable walking in the area both late at night after our dinner at the Castle and early in the morning (6am) on our hunt for the nearby Starbucks Coffee. The rooms had both a refrigerator and microwave. The hotel has Wi-fi but the signal was poor. Evidently a continental breakfast was offered but didn't start until 8am--far too late for us. Our only major issue with the hotel is the parking. Granted, parking in this area is at a premium, and I was VERY happy that they had a parking lot. In fact, it was a major factor in choosing the hotel, but be advised that the lot is small and that there is only one driveway in and out which means you cannot drive through and will have to back out onto a busy street to leave. The biggest concern is that they allow guests (and employees) to park in between the rows of cars which means you will most likely be blocked in when you need to leave. When we returned to the hotel after dinner at the castle we noted that two cars were blocking ours and since we planned to leave at 6:30am we mentioned the problem to the front desk. We were assured that there was another lot where they park their overflow and they had the keys to those cars and were planning to move them to the other lot in just a few minutes. We were assured that there wouldn't be a problem when we went to leave in the morning. Unfortunately, this wasn't true. When we went down to the lot at 6am to put our bags into our car there were now THREE cars (one of which belonged to the clerk at the front desk). The other two guests had been asked to leave their keys with the front desk so that their cars could be moved, but the gentleman at the front desk couldn't move them because he was the only one working. He assured us that someone would be coming in at 7am, and we delayed our departure until then, only to have that person not show up on time. My husband watched the front desk as the front desk clerk moved the three cars so that I could pull our car out. It took over 20 minutes before I was able to leave the lot putting us an hour behind when we had originally planned to leave. If you choose this hotel just know that you may be in a valet parking situation--either having to leave your keys with the front desk and/or waiting to be able to get your car. This hotel is a good value, with a great location, but if parking issues are important to you it's good to be aware of the potential for problems.

Reviews.Title: “SECOND VISIT, NOT AS GREAT AS FIRST!”
Reviews.Author: Captivemarket
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity in Nov 2009. I posted a review on here then as well. It was GLOWING. We again stayed here almost a year to the day of our first visit, and alot had changed. We had the exact same room and it had aged alot in 12 months. Kitchen dirty, large hole in wall behind entrance, stale smells and a HOT WATER TAP that just did not work, after sooooo many complaints. Finally got repaired on our 2nd last day...we stayed a week!! The location is AMAZING. ALBIN on the front desk still very professional and lovely, but other staff although friendly, did'nt seem to care about us or our queries!! This hotel needs a MASSIVE renovation, and it needs it FAST!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: margaritagirluk
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 5 nights in October 2010 while my son and I travelled LA to Las Vegas to San Fran and back to LA. We have been to LA before but stayed in Marina Del Rey but wanted a more central hotel in Hollywood. Arrived fine from the airport and got parked up easily. Parking is round the back on Franklin and although it looked like it had limited spaces we got parked every time except one and then we were advised to hand keys into reception desk and they managed to squeeze all cars in and move around as needed without any hindrance or trouble to us - great!! Welcome was super and we were made to feel right at home. Room was spacious and clean and breakfast was more than adequate - coffee, juice, yoghurts, pastries, toast etc. We booked tickets for Universal at desk and the guy there was super helpful. Only a few minutes walk from Chinese theatre and new Hard Rock Cafe. Safe at night and easy access to Hollywood, Universal Studios, Downtown. We had a great stay in Hollywood even though weather was rubbish - Dodgers baseball, Griffith Observatory, Hollywood Bowl, Warner Bros Tour and more. Will definately stay again!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location in Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: HaydnAustralia
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a central place close to Hollywood Blvd that was not too pricey and comfortable (after all - you don't go overseas to sit in a bloody hotel room do you!)...this place was excellent. Just a short stroll from the Walk of the Stars, a neat clean and comfortable room. Everything worked. The staff were friendly and helpful; the shuttle bus knew where we were to be picked up etc.... The place has a great hollywood theme with pictures etc - our Son who was 11 during the trip really liked this hotel. And as for Mum and Dad - we got a good nights sleep and a hot shower etc. Not really much else we needed. For the price this is a place that I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Autumn10077
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for the 3rd time in 2 years and it is still a great hotel. Itâ€™s so clean and the location couldnâ€™t be better. It is just behind Hollywood boulevard so you can walk there within a couple on minutes! The staff are so friendly and helpful. They cannot do enough for you! After we checked out they let us keep our luggage at the hotel until the evening free of charge. The rooms are very big and the beds are really comfortable! I wonâ€™t stay anywhere else when visiting LA. The hotel is in a really safe area and I would walk around with no worries. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, itâ€™s affordable, extremely clean and has a great location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, helpful staff, clean rooms - what more do you need?”
Reviews.Author: gig16
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity 17/9 - 22/9. As a single female traveller it's always a risk choosing places to stay - but I couldn't have felt safer at this hotel. Even returning to it late at night. Its in a fantastic location, right at the starting point for tours, on top of a metro line for public transport - and beside the bus line to get down to Santa Monica etc. The room was lovely and big, and very clean! Again I can think of nothing to fault at this hotel - choose it for price, location & service....thanks for a great start to my trip in the USA

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with Great classic style”
Reviews.Author: ArtsFactory
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff was Friendly and extreemly helpful. Our room was clean and spacious. The location is unbeatable for the Hollywood experience. what we liked best about the Celebrity is the Charm and the Nostalgic style and the great Breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Astridoodle
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for about ten days in November 2009. It's nearly a year later and I've been intending to write this review ever since. Of all the hotel experience I've had, this was probably the most positive. The first few days I was on my own and after an incident, the hotel staff were incredibly supportive and helpful, the manager even stepping in to make sure everything was ok, then checking up on me subsequently. I couldn't have asked for a better response. Staff were friendly, breakfast was plentiful, location is incomparable, rates were reasonable, rooms were spacious and clean. I'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: YOW88
Reviews.Content: DH and I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights... The location and price could not be beat... The rooms were hugh and clean but very dated. This hotel was literally 30 second walk to the Highland and Hollywood mall as well as most Starline tours start at this mall as well as the Red line metro is here as well. The first couple of nights, we stayed in room 207 which is located beside the apartment building and was quite noisy with loud music and parties going on til the wee hours but once I spoke with the front desk clerk, she moved us to room 212 which was alot quieter. All odd numbers will be on the side of the apartment building but I am not sure if other rooms on this side found it noisy or not. I would definitely stay here again.. Great location, rooms and staff...

Reviews.Title: “Room didnâ€™t match expectationsâ€¦”
Reviews.Author: MrsFletche
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel on the final night of our California road trip. With only one night to spend in Los Angeles we wanted somewhere close to the Hollywood tourist sights. This hotel matched our requirements perfectly, located in a quiet residential street directly behind the Hollywood & Highland Mall, and five minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard, Graumann, Kodak & El Capitan theatres, Walk of Fame, shops & restaurants. The hotel offers free parking, which is at a premium in the heart of the city; however the parking lot is very small, situated behind the hotel. It did not feel particularly secure, and we were concerned about being able to exit the lot the next morning for out flight. Luckily, we parked by the entrance, and managed to get out using a combination of Mr Fletcheâ€™s 100-point turn and me running from one end of the car to another (â€œLeft a bitâ€¦STOPâ€¦Right a bitâ€¦STOPâ€¦. Etc etc). The frontage of the hotel is bright and welcoming, with its canopy and neatly maintained patio area, and the lobby and corridors are bright, clean and modern decorated with movie posters and memorabilia. I was excited to see whether the rooms would carry on this trend â€“ I was highly disappointed. Our room was basic, drab and well in need of a good update. After a succession of fabulously comfortable beds on our trip, we were presented with three paper-thin pillows on our queen bed, and what looked like a very old, threadbare comforter. When we entered, the A/C was turned off, and the room was swelteringly hot; the windows were open and what appeared to be a party with very loud music was being held on a balcony in the apartment block opposite our room. Luckily the A/C worked a treat and the windows were well sound-proofed. On the positive side, there was a fridge, and ample storage/vanity space. Please note â€“ there is no elevator in this hotel meaning we had to lug two very large suitcases with along with all the junk we had collected over two weeks from the car park behind the hotel, up the steps to the lobby, up the steps in the lobby and then up a flight of stairs to our second-floor room. A complimentary continental breakfast is served each morning in the lobby with a good choice of items available, and coffee & hot water are available freely all day. The location and the free parking make this an ideal choice for being in the hub of Hollywood; however if I stayed in LA again, I would probably choose another hotel unless the rooms get a refurb.

Reviews.Title: “So close to the action”
Reviews.Author: Simplythebest51
Reviews.Content: Absolutely excellent location. Two minute walk and your at the Kodak Theatre. Only stayed one day but could have stayed a month. We all loved it. Rooms were clean.Nice to make use of the free tea and coffee all day. Nice outdoor area and we were lucky enough to see a squirrel wandering around outside. The service was excellent . Railway was a 5 minute walk. Didn't need a vehicle as we went to Universal Studio by rail. Would recommend this hotel to all. Thanks for the good memories. Will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and service”
Reviews.Author: QLDAnthony
Reviews.Content: Location and staff reception make this hotel a good choice if looking for a central Hollywood hotel. Free car parking and complimentary continental breakfast. A few minutes walk and you are standing in front of the Kodak Theatre. Close to public transport and popular tour collection points.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and very good service. You...”
Reviews.Author: sunthorn
Reviews.Content: Good location and very good service. You can walk to Hollywood and Highland in just a minute. Hollywood Blvd. is a few minutes walk and you can find lots of restaurants within walking distance. If you are looking for a decent hotel in a superb location, this is the one for you. Front staff was also very helpful. I would definitely stay here again on my next trip to Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “A friendly welcome”
Reviews.Author: getoutmore
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on other trip advisor reviews and it did not let us down. The location was great, just off Hollywood Boulevard. Our room basic but large. The high light was the staff, very helpful and knowledgeable, I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I LOVE this place”
Reviews.Author: ImpossiblePrincess73
Reviews.Content: I stay at this hotel every time I visit LA and I can't recommend it highly enough. I travel by myself and the staff are always very welcoming and helpful. On this particular visit, I arrived early in the morning and the check in staff went to great lengths to try to get me into my room before check in time. The rooms are comfortable and very spacious, and the little welcome bags are a nice touch. The free internet access in the lobby is really useful for us overseas travellers who don't have our laptops with us. The location is second to none, and as I single female, I can say that I never once felt unsafe in this neighbourhood, even after dark. If you have the choice, I would recommend flying into Burbank as opposed to LAX, as you can get the 222 bus from the end of the street straight to the airport for $1.50. VERY useful if you're on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Gask007
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Celebrity hotel we got a great welcome from the staff. We was given a welcome pack with water & snacks which i thought was a nice touch. The rooms are very clean but quite large. We had a very big problem with noise. The walls are too thin you can hear the conversations from the people next door and footsteps from the people above. This is the reason why i would not stay here in the future or recommend to a friend. The hotel has an onsite gym which is small with 4-5 machines but there was only myself ever in there so it was ideal. The Location is great for hollywood blvd approx 5 min walk. The hotel also has a private car park which is free of charge. Breakfast is served 7am til 10am. Breakfast is coffee tea & juice with croissants or chocolate muffins & yogart. Not the best selection but all food is really fresh. If you are a light sleeper the noise will be an issue for you, That is the only negative i can give this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “very central and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: love_2_travel666
Reviews.Content: The celebrity hotel is behind the Kodak theatre home of the Oscars. We wanted a hotel within walking distance and cheap, which for LA is very difficult until I came across this one when searching the internet. Just a short walk and you are on Hollywood boulevard, under the shadows of the very expensive Renaissance. It has free car parking, and when I booked the room in January the rate was higher than when we checked in, but I was not aware until the receptionist advised me and reduced our room rate, you donâ€™t get that in the bigger hotels. Breakfast is very basic, coffee and croissant if you want more then take your own or go to a close by restaurant. We were given a room on the ground floor at the bottom of the stairs, I was a bit unsure if we would be disturbed by other guests but we were not in fact we couldnâ€™t hear anyone else. The bed was comfy but the edges are a bit soft but as it was quite a good size we slept in the middle. Good base for 1 or 2 nights not sure if I would stay longer, although I would if I needed to be in the centre again, the restaurants are plenty and close by, no trouble with homless on going back to our hotel at night, maybe because it was in a quiet cul de sac.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT" 100% sure to be back :D”
Reviews.Author: sexymother
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very close to everything , the service is so overwhelming the staff are very pleasant they give above and beyond, yes it is a very small hotel but well mentained I say the management are very choosy with regards to their staff, well done. It is an excellent idea to put a small hotel like this right in between the big and famous hotels in hollywood. the rate is not to expensive compare to the others, breakfast is ok they serve a variety of muffins and croissant and some yogurts I just suggest they change their coffee to a very good one but their's is not so bad. We went to Universal studio and ride on the metro train it was cool cause that's our first time riding on it and yes walking distance too. we stayed for 4 nights and the staff made our stay more convenient. albin even give us options on what to do and where to go.the housekeeping was well oriented eventhough some of them don't speak english and all the time i see them smilling and say hi. VERY WELL FANATIC OF THIS HOTEL WELL DONE STAFF AND THE MANAGEMENT... SEE YOU ALL NEXT TIME..

Reviews.Title: “Clean! Great Location! Helpful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Noni322
Reviews.Content: Hotel is perfect ...not a big hotel but it is big jackpot if you are looking for a clean room with breakfast included, quiet place, walking distance to most attractions (along Hollywood Blvd.) and wonderful staff to help you how to go around in a place you haven't been to. It takes about 10 mins to go to Universal Studios if you take the Metro Red Line. Close to the mall and staying late out for dinners won't be a hassle to get back to the hotel. Our stay was short but we were able to do a lot because location plays a big part and the helpful tips from the staff did make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “WE WILL DEFINATLEY BE BACK”
Reviews.Author: yarding
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel, 6 nights, the location is superb, staff are very nice and helpful. room was comfortable ,with good working aircon, you must remember this is not a 5 star hotel if you want 5 star then pay for it!! dont pay any attention to the negative reports on this hotel they are obviously written by unreasonable people who who want 5 star at 2 star price, we will not hesitate to return to this hotel, highly recomended

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood, good. Hollywood Celebrity Hotel, bad.”
Reviews.Author: avonlee16
Reviews.Content: Hollywood has changed. Gone are the seedy street people pushing illegal "treats" at you. Gone are the tacky bars, bars on windows and trash filling the streets. Hollywood has really cleaned up it's act...too bad no one alerted the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. Location was perfect, Highland and Hollywood one block behind 9he Blvd. That was the only perfect thing about it. Upon check in we were told the room we reserved was taken due to booking error (2 beds) and we would have to sleep in a king size instead. For a price..they actually charged us the room difference although it was the hotel's mistake. Let's not talk about the Wal-Mart posters of Marylin and Elvis that made up the "decor" and skip right to the room. Walking down the hallway we noticed that it was hot. Really uncomfortably hot. Ha ha, no a/c! In the room there was a small window a/c unit which blows about 15cc an hour..too bad our dial was broken and we could not turn it past "medium hot". The window looked directly into someone else's apartment but having it open was better than the a/c. The comforter was covered in hair, not my hair, and something else which I'll leave to your imagination. If this was a hard copy letter I could have written it on the towels, they were thin as paper. And felt like sandpaper to boot. The whole place is dirty, run down and tacky. But they do include a continental breakfast. Hope you like tampico orange juice and a chunk of stale Costco muffin. 'Cause that is all your getting. This dump set us back $245. For $30 more I could have stayed at the Renaissance Hollywood Hotel, one half a block away and on a different planet.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: KIMANS
Reviews.Content: Now that I've seen L.A., I think I'd probably rather stay along the beach somewhere, but if you are coming for the Walk of Fame/tourist attractions, this is a good base to start from and will save you some money.

Reviews.Title: “Hollywood Bedbug Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BarnsburyBlake
Reviews.Content: Like plenty of other reviewers, we suffered bedbug bites. The hoteliers should read these reviews and get off their backsides and do something about this disgusting problem. My girlfriend now has a painful red rash on her torso. Also, for those looking to exercise while on holiday; stay elsewhere. This hotel advertises it has a gym, but it's closed down.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable Location & Value!”
Reviews.Author: girlish_sista
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights here is a king room with kitchenette! The hotel is in an UNBEATABLE location, 2 minutes from Hollywood Blvd and all the attractions it carries! Yet even with it's proximity, it is very quiet and has some wonderful features like free parking, a real rarity in LA! Our room, though it could have used a coat of paint, was very large and spotlessly cleaned each day. I have a friend that lives in LA and our room was larger than her whole apartment! The breakfast was complimentary and had a good selection! Don't listen to the whingers - these are the people that expect a full hotel buffet for free! It was free and consisted of hot coffee, croissants and muffins each morning. There was also yoghurt and juice on some mornings. We were very happy with our choice. Unbeatable location, great price and nice extras like free breakfast and parking. We would definitely stay here again when next in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely on top of Hollywood Blvd/Kodak Theater attractions, but has its limitations.”
Reviews.Author: dch1046
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated within a two minute walk to Kodak Theater and nearby attractions, which makes it perfect for that Hollywood Blvd area. The Magic Castle is close, a very short walk. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Know that this is a definite two star hotel, outside is pleasant, neat, and attractive. It has two floors and we did not find an elevator. This hotel would not be best for handicapped. Rooms are clean and ours was a suite with kitchen area. Rooms appear to have been renovated in the past few years. Motif is '50s and or '60s. The street and people noise can be a night time nuisance. If you have an auto the parking is free, but very limited and less than convenient for ease of parking and retrieving your vehicle. It is a definite down side. If no vehicle so much the better. Complementary breakfast is very limited as to selection. If being on top of Hollywood Blvd/Kodak area for a day or two is vital it will do, otherwise not highly recommended by this traveler.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience with a good price!!”
Reviews.Author: HerminiaPura
Reviews.Content: Guests are served 24 hours of coffee, tea and hot chocolate!! Strategic location, walking distance to Hollywood famous tourist spots. Very clean, and friendly front desk staff. I will definetly recommend this hotel to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for tourists”
Reviews.Author: Ezekiel84
Reviews.Content: My partner and I travelled from Australia and had been advised of the great value of this hotel, and we weren't let down at all. We chose this location because we wanted to see Hollywood, and we truly could not have picked a better hotel. It is close to the main attractions, tours, shopping, restaurants so the location couldn't be better. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful, not just on arrival, but any time we approached them, even if we were just passing through reception. Lovely room, free wi-fi, cable and breakfast. Highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, ordinary hotel.”
Reviews.Author: SteveV44
Reviews.Content: We arrived after a fairly long flight from Australia to be greeted by the friendly front office girl. So far so good. The place looked clean and inviting (lobby). The fun started when we thought we would pay for our room there and then for the 3 days we were staying. We were using a proper Visa Travel card that is good worldwide where Visa is accepted. Not at this hotel though!! After trying to explain, we gave up and forked out cash for the room plus an extra $50 deposit which left a hole in our traveling reserves. Ok move on, these things happen. To the room...which was located on the Hollywood Blvd side of the block. This was a big mistake as there is an apartment complex right next door. Our hotel window as about 2 metres from the apartments. The noise ALL night was unbelievable, from drunken parties where you can hear every word being yelled to screaming and people calling for lost cats at 4 in the morning. Then there was the bed and the absolutely disgusting pillows. Very sub standard and very ordinary. The room itself was clean but worn and tired. Crappy shower and all fittings like taps and electrical sockets were loose and old. The only highlight was the location though which was an easy 2 min walk to the Blvd and all the attractions there. This was perfect. Check out was fun also at 6.00am with a shuttle bus waiting to take us to LAX for our flight. The $50 we left as deposit mysteriously disappeared and the office girl was ringing other staff at their homes to locate it. "Are you sure you paid it" was her initial line of questioning. After nearly 25 minutes of argument and cutting into our airport travel time we got our money and hit the road. So our advise is give this place a wide berth and look elsewhere. Pretty ordinary hotel experience for such an iconic area.

Reviews.Title: “AFFORDABLE LUXURY AT A BEAUTIFUL PLACE”
Reviews.Author: uscreview
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Celebrity last week while sightseeing in Los Angeles. Upon arriving at the hotel we received a welcome bag after checking in. The bag was a sweet gesture from the management, and pretty much set a theme throughout our two days there. The staff offered personalized service which we greatly appreciated throughout our stay. For our deluxe room it was $129.00 plus tax which included free breakfast, wireless internet in our room, and free parking smack dab in the middle of Hollywood! And we all know how hard parking is to find! With the staff making you so comfortable, the beyond reasonable price, and the great location the Celebrity is a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tdot01
Reviews.Content: This trip was amazing. Specially thanks to the hotel. I had a great time here and all I can say is I hope this hotel keeps up all of its good work because I am going to keep coming here every year and I will highly recommend my family and friends to enjoy this experience as well. Long live Hollywood Celebrity Hotel!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway”
Reviews.Author: QAwsome2
Reviews.Content: My partner and I were travelling to California and found this beautiful hotel to stay in. The room were clean and spacious and the staff was very friendly. The only issue we found was the lack of parking. Other than that, the stay was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay!”
Reviews.Author: LisaPToronto
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I were looking for an excellent holiday and had searched many hotels to stay at, however this was the best hotel we could find with the best price ever! The staff was extremely friendly and warm. We went there from Toronto after many hours on the plane and the service was the best we have ever received!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and Economical”
Reviews.Author: RubzyFubzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a vacation, and it was a great value. the hotel staff was super friendly. It is also really close to the city. I would recommend this to anyone who is looking for a relaxing night in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, cute rooms, great price”
Reviews.Author: RachelPerry
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with friends for a week in LA and couldn't be happy with our choice of hotel. The staff was very sweet and accommodating. The rooms were cute and absolutely worth the price. The best part was the location- right in the center of hollywood. We had a great time here!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: OzDennyCrane
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a couple of nights in October. The location is excellent - right behind the Hollywood & Highland Shopping Centre, walking distance to the Walk of Fame, Chinese Theatre etc. The hotel is quite old and there is poor soundproofing on the rooms. Our room was #106 which is right next to the lobby and we could hear everything that was going on out there. They could easily improve this by sealing up the gaps around the door to the room. The room itself was comfortable enough and included a small kitchenette which was handy. The bathroom is a little dated, but was still OK. Parking is very tight, but we didn't have any problems, and I believe they have another parking lot elsewhere if the main lot (holds about 12 cars) is full. Breakfast is available in the lobby and consists of juice/tea/coffee and some dry croissants & muffins. It is barely edible, but I guess it is better than nothing. Some fresh fruit would be a huge improvement. There is a PC in the lobby for internet access too. Overall it was good value considering the great location, as you can pay much more for accommodation in this area. We found it to be fine for a couple of nights stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beware BedBugs!”
Reviews.Author: HappySydChampers
Reviews.Content: After a 14 hour flight from Europe we were glad to arrive here in the early evening. For a 2 star hotel the place looked clean, staff very friendly, location was perfect for Hollywood- it seemed too good to be true. After an hour of sleep I was woken up by itching and discovered bedbug bites on my body. The hotel staff member - although very sweet was unable to assist. After 3 hrs of internet searching we got a room in the Hollywood Roosevelt Hotel- more pricey but was very clean and made up for the initial bad experience in LA. I hope management attend to this problem as the place has the potential to be a good 2 star hotel unfortunately not on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Just awesome....like original Avatar locations”
Reviews.Author: JOHNCARLO_10
Reviews.Content: What a lovely little hotel tucked in behind the kodak centre. Could not fault a thing about this hotel. The price, the staff, the room, the location, the breakfast everything was great. I have found this terrific hotek on internet .everything is amazing about this hotel. BEST FOR COUPLES AND FAMILIES RIGHTS IN THE CENTRE OG HOLLYWOOD ***** 5 STAR

Reviews.Title: “you pay one night and the hotel charge 3 nights on your card...”
Reviews.Author: spain_10
Reviews.Content: be carful people from diferents countrys, the breakfast is only couple piece of bad breed and te that its, i am from spain, let me tell you something i never get my money back, the hotel givme a recive for one night but on my card balance showme 3 night, so lose my money , im call to many time from my country and no body helph, so becarful is better if you find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Economical and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: StevehampsonLondon
Reviews.Content: i have been there with my mates for 2 nights....for me comfortableness is important which i had.. it is an economical hotel with large rooms...Parking was a bit issue but not for me coz i was on my mate's car...lol yes i would recommend this hotel to people who are in search of economical hotels... i dont know about lunch or dinner...coz mostly v had them from outside... but yes Breakfast was good.... n yeah u will find very cooperative staff here

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kevin123Northyork
Reviews.Content: We spent last holidays there. I think it was a great experience. My girlfriend was the one who chose to stay there, which i didnt like at beginning but i must say its a great hotel. Loved the staff , location and yesthe free breakfast. We are planning to go back in summer, so see yaa guys!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “bedbugs!!!”
Reviews.Author: meggy111
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there in late November 2009. The location is great, the staff was very friendly and helpful........everything seemed to be perfect. But unfortunatly we woke up with red dots the next day. They were all over our body and the itching was terrible. We didn't know why they appear. Back home we went to see a doctor and he said we were bitten by bedbugs. I've never heard about bedbugs before, googled it and was really shocked! Now......1 month later it turned out that we brought them home too. I really don't know what we should do now..........................

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION. GREAT STAFF. NEEDS AN OVERHAUL.”
Reviews.Author: Captivemarket
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity for 4 Nights in December '09. The staff from the word go, were incredible (especially Alvin). The decor is straight out of a 'Golden Girls' episode and the rooms need a complete renovation, but I have to say, our stay was fantastic. The free breakfast was a great way to start the day. Although the rooms are a little on the old side, our beds were comfortable. Incredible location as well.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs”
Reviews.Author: NelloLondon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in late Nov 09 and the room I had (No. 114) had bed bugs and my husband and I were eaten alive. I had read reviews of this hotel before I went away and did not see any mention of this problem. However, I see that on 8 November someone else also had a problem with bed bugs and am concerned that nothing had been done to sort this out. These creatures can travel on your luggage and you can take them home with you. Therefore this problem should not be taken lightly. The staff were very helpful when we pointed this out but I would have been much more annoyed if I had known at the time that this was a longstanding problem and for this reason I would not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DanielCC
Reviews.Content: Excelent Hotel and location. Nice staff. Breakfast is also ok.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Manja009
Reviews.Content: Great locatinon, free parking, rooms wew nice and spacious, free breakfast...and we satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Fine for one night...................”
Reviews.Author: CACarlsbadkid
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were in town for a wedding at the Annex in Hollywood and we needed a clean and economical place to rest our heads for the evening. If you're looking for a clean, friendly, no frills or thrills hotel, the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel is the place to stay. The front desk staff are very nice and professional. We certainly appreciated being explained about the parking situation in great detail. The free parking lot is adjacent to the hotel. Like the previous viewer indicated, "it is a real mess" The lot is a sardine can, but yet, somehow, someway, at least 20 cars are squeezed in. On the morning of our departure, at checkout, the front desk told us that the hotel staff would move any car(s) blocking the driveway. The room was very very large and clean but very very old. Our room on the ground level faced the back alley just a few steps away from the parking lot. The bed was comfortable and closet space was plentiful. The bathroom was clean BUT dorm like in decor. My wife and I opted to skip the shower facilities the next morning; not aesthetically pleasing to say the least. The location was superb. We were able to walk to the wedding event, approximately 0.3 miles from the hotel. The hotel is a stones throw away from the posh Renaissance Hotel where room rates are much much higher. The Hollywood Celebrity Hotel spells convenience in every sense of the word for most Hollywood endeavors/outings. The complimentary continental style breakfast was average. It wasn't the Embassy Suites style breakfast, but just your basic necessities to get you going in the morning. So, if you're on a really tight budget and in need of a basic hotel in a great location-try it.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden little gem”
Reviews.Author: NYCleveland
Reviews.Content: I really love this hotel. It's not fancy, and there are few amenities (and the parking lot is a mess) but the rooms are absolutely huge for what you pay, and the staff is extremely helpful. It's tucked away on a quiet street in Hollywood, right near the hustle and bustle of Hollywood and Highland, and it's easy to either jump into the madness and keep it nice and quiet. One downside is that the hotel is adjacent to an apartment building that can be loud at night, so if you don't sleep easily with street noises, this may not be the place for you. For anyone who values a big, well proportioned room over a chic one, i can't recommend this hotel enough.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly and convenient”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneHelen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night with 3 children. Very convenient for what we wanted to do and the staff were so helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific location, large room, wonderful staff, terrible parking lot”
Reviews.Author: Susal
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right in back of the Hollywood and Highland Center, Kodak Theater, Grauman's theater. The hotel lobby, halls, decor is very cool, nice, and modern. The staff is extremely friendly and helpful. They remembered my name and said hello whenever I passed by the front desk. Our room was not fancy, but was quite large and had a full kitchen, which was great for us! (There is a Fresh and Easy grocery store a couple of blocks away). The room looked out to the parking lot, which was always entertaining. The tiny parking lot is on a very busy street, and it is impossible to turn around, so you must back out into the busy street. Also, there is not enough room for all the cars, so if the lot is full, the front desk staff will park your car in this parking lot and block in all the other cars. In the morning, we would watch the "musical cars" as the staff had to move cars out in order to let earlier parked cars out. If you were in a hurry in the morning, this could be a problem. We went to a concert at the Universal Studios Gibson Amphitheater, which was just a freeway exit or two away. The hotel is very convenient to Universal Studios, and of course the Hollwood Bowl and everything else Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: retirednurse061
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed one nite at this hotel. The hotel is older but has character. Please note that it has NO elevator. We were surprised that we had to carry our luggage up to the second floor but it was not a problem. The best thing about this hotel is the location. Just a few steps out the front door is the huge Highland Mall on Hollywood Blvd. We were there in only a few steps. We toured the Walk of Fame, Chinese Theater, and saw the Kodak theater. Also just opened is the new Wax Museum. We loved it. Cost was $25 and well worth it. We ate at California Pizza and the food was good. The hotel room has older furniture but the room was big with a separate room with table, frig and microwave. The bathroom is a good size also. HBO on TV and the front desk was very helpful and friendly. Use a flat rate from LAX with the Taxi drivers or you will pay metered (approx $87). We got a flat rate for $50. Don't know if we could have done better. The trip back to the airport was handled by the front desk as they contract with a shuttle and that trip cost $31 for two people and they were right on time, actually early. Good to know these details. We missed the continental breakfast as we had to leave early for our flight. But I would recommend this Hotel if you are there to tour Hollywood Blvd.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing fancy but a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Happy06Iowa
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is perfect; within walking distance of everything that you would want to see in Hollywood. It is right behind the Kodak Theatre, Hollywood Walk of Fame and the shopping area there. The hotel itself is rather dated and definitely nothing fancy. It was a little dirty but I think it is mostly from the age of the building. It was a good sized room and they do offer free bagels, muffins, juice, etc. for breakfast. They have free parking but it is a very small lot and once when we went to get into our car there were a few cars that were blocked in by other cars so just be cautious of that. The staff was very friendly. As long as you aren't expecting a 5-star hotel and you just want a good location this hotel would be a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetdreamsNY
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a hotel that is close to Hollywood and all the attractions then this is the place!! The hotel is located behind the Kodak Theatre so is it walking distance to lots of places (Grauman's Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame, Museums, and GREAT shopping, and its also across from the Magic Castle- which they give you tickets to get in...that was very exciting for us because not just anyone can get into the Magic Castle- you have to know a member there or be a member..AWESOME bonus)!! They also offer a continental breakfast everyday, which was pretty decent and a great little way to start the busy day. The rooms are spacious and pretty clean BUT there were a few downfalls..1st the hotel isn't a very modern hotel...some things are a little out of date (bathrooms especially) and there isn't an elevator so be prepared to carry your luggage up and down a few flights. 2nd the parking lot is around the corner from the hotel and VERY small- sometimes you get blocked in by other guests- it can get a little messy but itâ€™s free so i didn't complain :). Overall i would give the hotel a 6 out of 10 and I recommend it to friends who want to go and sightsee Hollywood. They are decently priced especially compared to the surrounding hotels and its by far the best location out there for people who want to tour around. Good luck on your search!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here If You Like Dirty Rooms and Bad Staff”
Reviews.Author: AEbunny
Reviews.Content: I wrote a review of this place right after my stay but took it down to see how the outcome of my situation would turn out. Now I'm re-writing my review. Back in April I went on a roadtrip to Hollywood with my girlfriends to celebrate my birthday. I chose the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel b/c of the reviews here and it's great location to everything we wanted to do. Never did I delude myself into thinking that I expected a luxurious hotel stay here. All I was looking for was a simple clean room to take a shower and rest my head down at the end of the day; that was it. Sadly The Hollywood Celebrity hotel could not even meet these low standards. The one positive things about this hotel is it's location. It's located in a prime area convenient to all sorts of Hollywood attractions so I won't take that away from them. From the moment we checked in after our long day at Magic Mountain, we kept discovering bad things about our room that eventually led us to check out after our first night there. First when walking into the room, there was a very stale, musky odor... as if it'd been a while since the room had been occupied. Okay no big deal, my friends and I opened the windows to air out the room. The room was suppose to come with free high speed internet (via a ethernet cord you plug into your laptop) but our internet was not working. The front desk assistant couldn't figure out what was wrong and it couldn't be solved until the following morning. We'd have to use the wireless provided in the front entrance. As my friends and I were unpacking our things my friend noticed a disgusting puddle of something sticky on the vanity counter and on the built in blow dryer. Honestly I don't know what exactly it was but it was as if someone poured a thick layer of corn syrup on the vanity counter and let it sit there for a month. Just plain nasty. The maid service must have been asleep on the job the last time they cleaned this room. The final straw was when we needed to take showers and get ready to meet some local friends up for the night. We had a really long day of driving from San Francisco before the crack of dawn to going straight to Magic Mountain from there for some roller coaster fun. The sad part was that for some reason at 7pm on a Wednesday night there was NO HOT WATER LEFT. Yep, we all had to take miserable cold showers and it was not fun. After this we had no desire to bother asking for a new room. Just the few short hours we'd been there had left a bad taste in our mouth and there was no way the hotel could redeem itself. That night we ended up booking a room at the Hollywood Renaissance Hotel right down the road (which was a wonderful hotel and worth the extra money to stay at... read my review about it). The following morning when I checked out, I mentioned our bad experience to the front desk assistant, she was apologetic about our stay and asked me to leave my number so that the manager could contact me. They mentioned that the manager would be in that afternoon and that she'd get back to me as soon as possible. The manager didn't bother contacted me until a week after I checked out. That to me is simply unprofessional and sent a message to me that customer satisfaction wasn't on their list of priorities. Knowing that a guest had such a lousy stay, you'd think the manager would want to talk to me about my experience. Instead, the manager was rather rude and cold to me. She just flat out asked what I wanted after telling her my story, which confused me. Basically she just wanted to know what kind of refund I was looking for. She said she'd credit me $20 for our bad experience. Gee, thanks! The funny part is that I never saw that $20 credit go back to my bank account. I didn't bother trying to contact them to follow-up on this credit... why waste the time given the kind of attitude given to me by this hotel. I'm not sure how this hotel has so many positive reviews. I notice that there are a lot of people who've made only 1 contribution to TripAdvisor so who knows what kind of friends they're getting to write glowing reviews of them. Trust me people, spend a little more money and stay elsewhere... don't bother wasting your money on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location - average rooms”
Reviews.Author: mockingjay
Reviews.Content: The Hollywood Celebrity hotel is located within a couple of minutes walk to Hollywood blvd and all the tourist locations that go along with that. In particular it is nearby both Graumman's Chinese theatre and El Capitan theatre as well as the Kodak theatre and several museums. There is also the Hollywood/Highland metro station and the outdoor mall which has a lot of great restaurants and cafes as well as shops. I was a little worried when I checked into the hotel because it is in a quiet cul de sac off a main road that appeared to be in the middle of a residential area but it is in reality just hidden behind all the chaos of Hollywood blvd. The location should be the reason you stay at the hotel as the rooms are pretty average. However, it is relatively quiet and the staff are friendly. I stayed 4 nights in total and am really glad I picked on somewhere so central which considering the location was very affordable. The room I booked consisted of a small kitchenette (really just a fridge and table) and a bathroom with a large closet area that was great for lots of luggage. The bed was large and comfrotable. My only issue was with the noise from the parking lot and one of the streets which my window basically overlooked. It was OK if I kept the window shut at night and turned on the air con. The computer in the lobby is free for guests however if there are other people waiting it can be a bit of an inconvenience. I was expecting free wifi in the rooms however it does not reach beyond the lobby. I believe there is cable internet in room meaning you need a laptop but this would not work for hand held devices etc.

Reviews.Title: “Insect”
Reviews.Author: swg22chair
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 5 days and developed a rash. The doctor said is due to mites.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special, no better than a motel”
Reviews.Author: LA_out_kast
Reviews.Content: Except for the location, this hotel is nothing better than a motel. Don't bring a car because parking is troublesome. I suggest you go for a bed and breakfast and save your money for the more fun part of LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for Hollywood, good room, spendy”
Reviews.Author: ktn49
Reviews.Content: LIKED: Great location if you are touring Hollywood itself. Walking distance to Hollywood Blvd, Mann's Chinese Theater, mall. Close to Hollywood Bowl and Hwy 101. Nice staff. Clean rooms. Free parking. DISLIKED: If you've read my reviews you know I'm not a fan of the price many motels are charging (they call it a hotel, it appears to be a nicely renovated motel). Parking is free but is directly off a very busy street during rush hour and can be difficult to cross over lanes when it is busy. OVERALL: We have stayed here twice and I think it is a decent place to stay and would recommend it if you are searching for a low-key, clean motel, that is well located for a Hollywood trip. As with other motels in LA, I think it is overpriced for a place to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidTraveller35
Reviews.Content: Fabulous location, only a few minutes walk to Hollywood Boulevard and one stop on the train to Universal Studios. City tour buses are also literally around the corner. This a very clean, boutique hotel with great knowledgeable staff. There's a nice outdoor seating area to have breakfast in or relax after a day sightseeing. It was also nice to have free internet. The only negatives are: thin walls (hope your neighbours don't like to watch tv at 6am!) and this hotel needs a few more tables outside as breakfast can be crowded.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Find”
Reviews.Author: MelGeelong
Reviews.Content: Found this little ripper on the internet. What a lovely little hotel tucked in behind the kodak centre. Could not fault a thing about this hotel. The price, the staff, the room, the location, the breakfast everything was great. Our room on the second floor had obviously been renovated as every thing seemed nice and new. To get to the strip we cut through the kodak centre and we were there. About 150 metres. With its great location came access to all eateries and shops of course so no shortage of things to look at or eat. Vending machines provided by the hotel offered cheap snacks and drinks. Free Tea and Coffee was available all day in the lobby. This hotel was a great find and I highly recommend it. Dont hink you could go wrong with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Setting”
Reviews.Author: FLUGEN
Reviews.Content: Me & my family of 4 (with 2 kids) stayed at this hotel in the middle of August for 4 nights. I only have positive things to say about the hotel. It is amazingly near the glittering spots in Hollywood. Infact its only a 5 min walk to Hollywood Walk of Fame, to the Kodak Theater etc. The Metro & buses are also within walking distance. And you feel safe in the neighbourhood. Infact the street is quiet. The hotel also offers a small breakfast that keeps you going in the morning and the rooms, although rather dated, offer every basic amenitiy. The staff is friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION and VALUE”
Reviews.Author: jessta7
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a few years back and I could not get over the great location. When you do not care about staying in a five star hotel and just want to explore, this is the perfect place. I had no issues with this hotel, it had an old Hollywood feel to it. For my first time to Hollywood I think it was just perfect and it didn't cost us an arm and a leg to be right in the middle of all the action.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect more than a bed to sleep”
Reviews.Author: Rodukas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located near the hotest part of Hollywood, and that's its key selling point. Otherwise, it's a classic hotel with no special interest. Rooms are rather clean, but the bathroom is a bit scary. What really pissed me off is when I woke very early to leave LA before the traffic jam and found that my car was parked at the very end of the parking lot, with 4 cars blocking mine. It took more than an hour for the hotel to get the keys of the other cars and let me get out. Of course, I then got stuck in the middle of the traffic...

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Love4travels
Reviews.Content: Wow! Hotel was clean, room spacious with fridge and microwaves oven, free guest parking, wifi, continental breakfast included..not a recently renewed hotel, but it's very clean and his location was fantastic: walking 5min out of the hotel there is a big open air shopping centre, where you can have dinner...and if you walk through it you'll be directly on the Walk of Fame! And.. the hotel is a 15min by car from Universal Studios, 30min from LAX Airport, 15min from Beverly Hills and 30min from Santa Monica.... I highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hollywood location”
Reviews.Author: oleiros
Reviews.Content: Some negative things... We found a cockroach in the bathroom, but otherwise the rooms were clean. Lots of space in the rooms and our room had a small kitchenette with dining table, fridge and microwave. Breakfast is served in the corridor and there's a patio outside to eat your breakfast. Staff were friendly, though they require you to leave your car keys at the front desk and sometimes (like in our case) move around cars in the very small (but free) parking lot... They put our car in a really tight space and nearly caused my brother to have a meltdown trying to get it out in the morning. This hotel has its charm and feels very 'Hollywood' and the location is great, just next to Hollywood and Vine and the Kodak Theatre. And for any one visiting LA, you should make the effort to take the subway to Downtown LA and visit it. My brother and I did so and saw no fellow tourists, and had a nice experience visiting City Hall were we went to the observation deck (again no tourists) for free to see great views of the city. We even had lunch in the small shop inside City Hall and had some interesting chats with locals, including a city councillor.

Reviews.Title: “Tired yet spacious in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: miss_emc
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very basic and needs a bit of an uplift, but is very roomy and has some decent facilities. The staff are very helpful and pleasent and the location is awesome - right behind the Kodak theatre and only a 5 minute walk from the Hollywood and Highland centre. It's fairly good value, and nice enough for a couple of nights but definately nothing spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “LOCATION, LOCATION, LOCATION!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mizzychizzy
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Los Angeles and we booked this hotel after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor. We arrived late evening after a 10 hour flight so we just wanted our bed. The staff on arrival were very friendly and immediately took our 3 large suitcases to our room. The room was a good size with lovely bedding. Everything was clean (which is the most important thing to us). The only thing that seemed a little tired was the toilet, which could benefit from being updated. Next morning we took a walk through the hotel and found it to be very charming. We loved the deco look. The breakfast was fresh and sufficient to let us have an early start.
