The staff are very hospitable and welcoming and the rooms are very clean. The hotel has a nice decor and the rooms are very spacious. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking for great value.

Reviews.Title: “The hotel was a great find”
Reviews.Author: Dianne8868
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 2 week holiday in the USA and stayed in August/ September for 4nights at this hotel. I was happy with the overall experience and felt that the staff were both helpful and friendly. We chose the hotel for its location in Hollywood and the fact that it was near the shopping mall, Hollywood Highlands and attractions such as Graumans Chinese Theatre, The walk of fame were literally 5 mins walk. The room was large and airy. I was pleased that we were on the ground floor as next to the hotel gym and spa room and close to the breakfast area. The mirrors on the walls made the place look very spacious. The daily maid service was good and supplied us with plenty of clean towels each day. I loved the queen size beds and the a/c was also good As we did not drive we were able to get around on the public transport system with ease. The hotel reception staff helped us out on a few routes. You can buy a $3.00 day bus pass and go anywhere in LA which was brilliant. The hotel has free internet services which was handy for sending and checking email. Complimentary breakfast of couissants and muffins were served each day. I appreciated this as a welcome relief from my usual over indulgence of eating large amounts at breakfast time. The hotel does not have a free shuttle service to the LAX but they were able to arrange transportation on our behalf at a reasonable cost. I have no complaints and would definitely stay here if I were ever in town again!!

Reviews.Title: “All you could need in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: 4MR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the HCH for 3 nights in August. The location is brilliant and having free parking is a bonus. However bear in mind that the parking lot isn't big enough to fit all the guests cars in so you have to double park and leave your keys at reception a lot of the time. Rooms were huge and had a fridge, dining table, tv etc and were very clean. The bathroom was a bit tired looking but very clean and big. My only criticism would be that the shower was really weak and so it took ages to wash your hair but for the price and location it can't be beaten. I disagree with the reviewer who said it seemed spooky, the road was absolutely fine and we never felt unsafe at any point including comeing back very late at night (we are two girls on our own).

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: AnnaLucy
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay! This hotels location is fantastic, the staff are delightful and the rooms are superb. Need I say more?

Reviews.Title: “Such a brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: anne2606
Reviews.Content: Our two bedrooms suite with kitchenette was big and welcoming . The bathroom looked very worn but it was perfectly clean so we didn't really mind . The man at front desk was really nice and helpful every time that we asked for information . Breakfast was really bad : food consisted of three trays of unfrozen but still cold croissants, bagels and muffins . And be aware that breakfast is only served from 8a.m. onwards . At least theoretically, because on two out of the tree days that we spent here there was a note on the breakfast table in the morning to warn clients that breakfast would be at 8:10 . So if you plan to leave early or if you are awake with jetlag, forget about the hotel breakfast . But as most other reviews stated, this hotel is all about great location at a reasonable price, so bad breakfast is not such a big deal .

Reviews.Title: “Truly great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Henrik22
Reviews.Content: Basically this was just a great place to stay in Hollywood. The hotel has a good, moderate size, the staff is very helpfull and forthcoming, and you're only two minutes away from all the action on Hollywood Boulevard. We really couldn't have found a better place to stay in Hollywood - 2 adults and 2 teenage boys - and have nothing whatsoever to complain about. The street is quiet and feels very safe, it was great to have a parking spot on the hotel's own fenced parking lot, the Hollywood Boulevard is only a few steps away, and it was great to sit on the porch outside the hotel and relax after a busy day. Will defititely recommend this hotel to everyone who wants to be close to the attractions of Hollywood, Beverly Hills and LA ... and even for tourists it was really easy to get to find your way around in this huge metropolis ... and make it back to the hotel again every night.

Reviews.Title: “Great price, close to stuff but a little spooky.”
Reviews.Author: Talofa
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at this hotel 8/4/06-8/6/06. Just like the others reviewers mentioned, the place was good because of the price ($109 a night) and the location/proximity to entertainment and Metro (5 minute walk to Metro, Universal Studio's one stop away $3.00 for day pass), but.... I was a bit scared because the street the hotel is on seems a litte dirty with old cars parked on the side of the road, shopping carts all over the sidwalks. The bedding had a strong Clorox bleach smell and had holes in it. The shower was a little bit worn. I liken it to staying at an Army Guest House. Just the basics.

Reviews.Title: “top spot”
Reviews.Author: Drdavid
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews cover the story. Its the great location, friendly staff and comfortable, clean unpretentious rooms. If you want a marble lobby walk two minutes up the road to the Renaissance and pay four time the price!! I cant think of a better place to stay for exploring Hollywood. I booked a car on the fourth day to start our California road trip and you can arrange this through Hertz in The Renaissance and just walk 25 yards to pick up your car!! free cabled internet was the best and least hassle out of the ten hotels we stayed in during our three week trip. You cant go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, not the Hilton”
Reviews.Author: kaseygirl
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my son & his girlfriend, needed a suite, and this worked. Location convenient for Hollywood destinations. Downfalls were the older furniture, no restaurant, uncomfortable beds. Not sure if I'd stay here again but it was priced right and roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: SusanW68
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic! Talk about amazing location! It was literally steps away from the Hollywood Walk of Fame, Hollywood & Highland Center, Graumman's Chinese Theater, Kodak Theater, and El Capitan! It was just perfect. Loved the "suites" and it really had that Old Hollywood feel. Not necessarily luxurious, but nice & clean and just ultra-cool! We were very pleased with the entire experience. Parking kinda stunk, but the hotel staff was very helpful (took our keys and parked our car FOR us). Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Really liked, great stay.”
Reviews.Author: jcmh
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at begiining of our holiday and loved it so much that we stayed again at end of holiday. Room was good, beds very comfy. Staff were very helpful. You cannot beat it for the convenient situation, only 5 minutes from major attractions. We did not hear any noise at night maybe because after doing so much we were exhausted and slept like babies. Would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and fantastic Value”
Reviews.Author: server
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights and booked based on previous reviews. It was in a Perfect location and for the price ( approx $80 a night per room ) best value that we could find. 2 mins walk from Kodak Theatre and Holly wood boulevard. Room was very large, 2 Queen Beds, small kitchenette, bathroom and dressing area. Room was clean didn't have the most modern furniture but hey you can live with that. Constant hot water with powerful shower. Free wireless internet available or u can use the PC downstairs for free. Breakfast was muffins, bagels,juice, tea coffee - included in price. Staff very helpful, stored our bags for the day while we went to Universal Studios, eventhough we had checked out. Definitley recommend this hotel to others, when you combine the price with location it gets top marks from me. If ever staying in Hollywood again we would stay here without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in Hollwood, Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well I have to admit - I was very nervous after I booked this hotel. I decided to travel to LA not knowing it was the week before Memorial Day and most hotels had put their prices up. My old reliable, The Ramada in West Hollwood were asking for room rates over 100% more than what I had paid previously. I decided to give Hollywood Celebrity Hotel a go and I was pleasently surprised. Amazing value for money. Its not The W or the Four Seasons but if you are after a very reasonably priced, very clean and conveniently located hotel in Los Angeles this one is for you. Located right next to the Kodak Theatre, Hollywood and Highland Shopping Complex, Chinese Theatre, Walk of Fame and only a short drive to Universal Studios this hotel is PERFECT. The rooms are huge and ideal for pre party drinks with some friends before heading out. Like other reviewers have said - parking is extremely tight but Hollywood and HIghland shopping complex has a huge, secure car park and it is only $10 per day. Very safe to walk from there to hotel late at night as well. Will definately stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nostalgic Hollywood Hotel with Charm”
Reviews.Author: ask_mikey
Reviews.Content: Before I describe the hotel, let me first mention that I'd categorize this hotel as "superior tourist class". It's nothing like the adjacent Renaissance Hotel, but it's a far better value (in my opinion). For starters, it has that "old world" Hollywood charm -- the interior has an "art deco" look, and the walls are lined with nostalgic Hollywood posters & memorabilia. The beds are not as "comfy" as the nearby "Hollywood Hills", but the location is better, and the staff is every bit as hospitable as they are at "Hollywood Hills" & "Magic Castle" hotels. We only stayed for 4 nights, but it was a perfect fit for our needs. BTW, if you want to visit the Magic Castle, the Celebrity hotel is a member and can get you tickets (but be sure to bring a jacket & tie). Its best attributes are: 1. A great location, you can walk thru the adjacent Koday Theatre complex, right onto Hollywood Blvd. It's an easy 5-10 minute drive to Universal Hollywood 2. Value & price -- the rooms are large & adequate and a great value. We had a double-king room (it was huge). 3. Helpful & friendly staff. They bend over backwards to make your stay enjoyable 4. Decent amenities, free internet access, cool lobby, and a nice garden/patio outside the front of the hotel 5. Rooms have a small kitchen -- this is really convenient for those who want to "eat in". 6. It has a nostalgic Hollywood charm, complete with one-of-a-kind mural in each room (we had John Wayne in ours). The negatives are: 1. Parking is free, but it is very tight (it's best to have them park your car for you) 2. The beds are adequate & acceptable, but could be a bit more cozy/comfy 3. The room decorations remind me of the Ramada Inn, but they are adequate Overall, this is a great value hotel with a great location. I'd definitely stay here again. I stayed at the "Hollywood Hills" on my previous visit, and I like this location a little better.

Reviews.Title: “Some one is joking”
Reviews.Author: raven40
Reviews.Content: If you like the bottom of the Days Inn barrel or are satisified with uncomfortable beds and floors that look to grimey to walk on barefooted and showers with shower heads so clogged that the water trickles and very well worn 50's furniture and desk clerks with unintelligble accents than this is a place for you. Seedy is a kind word. Yes you are only feet from Hollywood Blvd and Kodak Center and The Star walk and Mann Chinese Theater and all the souvenier shops in LA but the street the hotel is on has numerous run down hotels that make you feel you want to be securely inside your room at sundown. Stay away. I have no idea what criteria the people that wrote 5 star reviews of this place use to judge hotels but they surely blew it on this one. I know I must surely have stayed in worse but I can't remember a place as worn out as this one andI am pretty sure they were less than single star bad dreams in scary parts of Europe. The room I had was a king for $99 .. a fair price would have been $39. don.brown@brownchild.com

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A small and unassuming hotel just off the main highway. Rooms were quite large and well appointed. The old holywood style art definitely added some character aswell. Staff very friendly and didn't seem bothered when I asked questions or needed to book a shuttle bus etc. In the foyer they have an internet terminal which is great for sending emails, but unfortunately you can't hook up your digital camera to upload photos (they forbid it). I would definitely stay here again if in LA. The location is great and the price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights on business. Good location in quite Cul de Sac and just a short walk to restaurants. The room I had was large (looked like it used to be a bed-sit) with a comfy bed, bathroom a bit dated but hey, at the price...no complaints! Free carpark is a bonus, although it's best to park closer to the entrance, you can get blocked in which can delay an early morning start. Free use of the internet was also welcome. For the $s, I'd say it's pretty hard to beat.

Reviews.Title: “What you need to know about Hollywood Celebrity”
Reviews.Author: Big_Mick81
Reviews.Content: Ok folks, here's what to expect from the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel. I stayed there with my partner in March and really enjoyed my time. Firstly the positives. The staff here are magnificent, in particular one of the gentlemen at the front desk (his name escapes me). He would greet us every time we entered and seemed like he genuinely cared about how our day was and what we did. He also gave us many tips on where to go, where to eat and how to get around as we didn't have a car for the first couple of days. Although I stayed there a month ago, I have stayed in around 12 hotels since then as part of a worldwide vacation and my girlfriend and I still talk about how he was the nicest 'front desk dude' we have come across. Another positive is the location. The hotel is on a dead-end street behind Hollywood Blvd. The Highland Shopping complex provides a great backdrop to the hotel and is a top place to grab a bite or browse the numerous shops. The rooms are very spacious and there is plenty of room to relax. The free parking is a nice touch, and we never had trouble finding a park. The breakfast was also simple, but a good way to tie your stomach over till lunch. My biggest gripe was the fact that there was a fair amount of noise at night from the apartment block next door. However we were there during Spring Break and from the sounds of it, the teenagers were really enjoying themselves. If you are a budget traveller and you enjoy quality service, stay here. If you expect fine French toiletries and Egyptian cotton sheets, don't. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 10am and although car parkwas full, reception let us double park and leave our keys, the car had been moved to a proper space by our return. Check in was quick and freindly. The location is perfect, directly behind the Holywood and Highland, but on a quiet street. It was a 2 minute walk to the Kodak theatre. The rooms were a good size and had everything we needed. Coffee and free internet via a PC in reception area were avaiable 24hrs. Breakfast was Danish and Muffins with coffee and juice whih was taken back to your room. Would stay again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “fun Old Hollywood building - great value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a kitchy remodeled hotel that has preserved an old Los Angeles feel to it, architecturally. The staff are amiable and knowledgeable about the area's attractions. There is only one major drawback: the parking situation. Other reviewers speak of "great free parking". The reality is that the lot can accommodate about 20 cars, several of which end up blocked in by other cars. One evening, I got back at about 7pm and found the parking lot full. I drove around to the lobby and was told that my only recourse was to park at the gas station a block away for $5. At the time, I had a new car and felt uneasy about doing this. Another evening, I went to get my car, found it blocked in, and was unable to leave. Guests keep their car keys, and there is no valet service. If you want to have guests visit - forget it. There is a 2-hour guest parking promise, but due to the limitations I described above, no way. Street parking is nonexistant, due to strict city restrictions. Lastly, the traffic in this area is insane. If you are not from a city and are not used to driving in strenuous conditions, stay in a less populated area. I live in San Francisco, and this is SF times ten. Aside from what I have mentioned, you will be close to many tourist attractions, and are in an historic district.

Reviews.Title: “Give & Take”
Reviews.Author: keversole
Reviews.Content: Rooms have an excellent location, free parking, and a free (if basic) continental breakfast. Cons are that the rooms are extremely dated & dark. Everything screams budget. Very similar to what you'd find at a budget European hotel. Not even as nice as a typical Super 8. Just depends on what is important to you I guess. Staff was nice, we got a slightly cheaper rate just by calling direct vs. booking on-line.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent price, in the heart of Hollywood!”
Reviews.Author: freebiegrabber
Reviews.Content: My parents stayed here when they visited me last fall. PROS: -dirt cheap (approx. $100-$120/night) -located a block from Hollywood Blvd., walking distance to all the popular tourist attractions -free parking -free Internet kiosk in lobby (warning: the PC is loaded with spyware) -free continental breakfeast in lobby CONS: -small rooms; you have to turn sideways to fit more than one person at a time in the bathroom! -despite being recently renovated, the rooms still seem "dated"; cheap carpet, paint, linens, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location with FREE parking!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel from 18 - 21 March and loved it! The location was superb directly behind Kodak theatre and they offered FREE parking! The carpark was a bit small and there's usually cars double parked. But if you ask the reception for assistance when you want to go out, they are more than glad to help shift the cars away. Our Charlie Chaplin room was spacious and had a lovely dressing area. Breakfast was a simple fare of muffins and bagels and there was no where to sit and eat, but we were fine with that. Another big plus is that they have free internet access at their computer terminal in the lobby. Only minus point was that our room was on the 2nd floor and they have no elevators. So if you have heavy luggage, do request for a room on the ground level. Albert, from the hotel reception, was extremely helpful with directions and sightseeing tips and very very friendly. Do look for him for great tips on where to go to catch a great pic of the Hollywood sign. Overall, we were very satisfied with our stay there. We would definitely recommend it to anyone on a budget and looking for great value!

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our honeymoon in the US. If you are looking for a great location this is the place, situated right behind Kodak Theatre where out the back you will see the Hollywood sign on the hill, this location is just great. A walk around the corner brings you to Hollywood Walk of Fame. Grauman's Chinese Theatre and the subway. The public transport is also great to get to the farmer's markets (a must see) and Santa Monica Blvd and Venice Beach. It has free internet access for a 15 minute period which is great as most hotels do not have access or you have to pay. Reception are happy to answer questions and this hotel comes with a continental breakfast (to be more specific orange and poppyseed muffins, all day coffee, bagels). There are also shops close to get drinks or food. Its an older hotel that has been renovated in the last 12 months but its clean and our room had a small kitchen with fridge and microwave. The water is hot for a great shower also. All in all a must to say - I'd do it again!

Reviews.Title: “superb location... free parking....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: superb location... free parking.... nice staff... Everything was smooth, I`ll sure stay there again!!! Don`t throw away money on other hotels in this area.. It`s cheap and clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little tucked away hotel with access to highways and Metro”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay if you want to be centrally located in LA, with or without a car. There's a post office, a Virgin music store, coffee shops and a California Pizza Kitchen all a quick walk away. We were on an architectural jaunt of the city and could access the Metro, three blocks away, for a comfortable and inexpensive ride to Pasadena to visit The Gamble House. We also rode the Metro to Pershing Square and had a fine tour of the Historic Core from the LA Conservancy. We drove to Watts Towers, but could have Metroed there from the Highland & Hollywood stop near the hotel. Whenever we needed to find a site, like the Ennis House or the Hollyhock House, the friendly staff would do a MapQuest to help us get there. The beds were firm and the rooms were sufficiently spacious; a very good deal when compared with the nearby hotels. All the breakfast table really needed for an upgrade was some milk or half and half for coffee and maybe some fresh fruit. For those who like to get a hike in before the day begins, the hills just behind the hotel are filled with architectural gems. There's a wonderful Japanese restaurant with great views and a community garden not too far to walk to. The Magic Castle is just around the corner and the hotel helped us get tickets to a wonderful magic show. The food there was good, too; I'm bringing my family back to Hollywood and we'll be using this hotel as our base of operations. Ripley's Believe It or Not Museum & the El Capitan are a few blocks away. Just a superb location all around!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Excellent, Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: filogirl
Reviews.Content: After agonising months of searching for a hotel in LA, I finally came across this hotel online. I was a little apprehensive at first (the reviews and just the stories I've heard of LA/Hollywood) but after meeting the excellent staff I felt right at home. This hotel is in an excellent location just behind Hollywood and Highland and close to other destinations (if you have a car) the front desk can orgaise tours for you. There's also FREE internet acess at the front lobby but usage is only for 15 mins per guest. Continental breakfast is served daily (but be quick!) and there's coffee and tea all day. Keep in mind that this place is cheap so there's basic ammenities. We only needed this hotel for a place to sleep and there were no complaints from my mum or sister. I do plan on returning to LA this June and will defiently stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Great little bargain”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I would highly recommend this little hotel to anyone on a budget visiting the Hollywood area. It was very clean, the decor is as advertised, original and interesting, and above all, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. It was a stone's throw away from the Hollywood-Highland complex (pricey mall), and Hollywood Boulevard and the Walk of Fame. Even the Continental breakfast, usually a disappointing collection of doughnuts, was above average with varied bagels, croissants and juices. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel , good location and price”
Reviews.Author: juddy43
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been recommended to us from friends who had visited Hollywood before. We had looked at a few other but found this one too look and sound the nicest from photos and descriptions. We are glad we stayed there, we had a wonderful time in Hollywood with this Hotel only being a 2 minute walk to Hollywood BLVD. All the staff were helpful and polite, we will definately stay here again when we come back and will recommend it to all of our friends wishing to visit Hollywood. :o)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Hotel”
Reviews.Author: em129
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 night in early Febuary. The stay was wonderful. Great room size, clean and convient to Hollywood area and transportation. The staff was very helpful with directions to anywhere you wanted to go. Felt safe walking at night by myself around the area. I will stay here again when I get back to the area. If you go on a tour with starline from the nearby chinese theatre ask for Brian to be your guide.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value & Great Tourist Location”
Reviews.Author: safarijones
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hollywood Celebrity Hotel for 1 night while travelling via LA to Mexico. We decided to stay there as we wanted to see a few tourist attractions but had limited time and knew we would be jet-lagged - this hotel was perfect for that. The rooms were very large. The decore was dated but everything was clean. The bed was comfortable and the shower pressure good. It is about a 3 minute walk through to Hollwood Boulevard with the walk of fame, chinese theatre and a number of shops and restuarants. Reception were very friendly. Only 2 complaints: 1) We were told by reception that a cab to the airport would only be around $40 so we booked that rather than the shuttle at $30. The cab was $80 - take the shuttle. 2) We were in a room on the right side of the corridor. Next to the hotel on this side is an apartment complex with a pool and the doors to the apartments lead off an outdoor walkway which is opposite the hotel room windows. A large group of friends decided to congregate on the walkway outside their apartment from abour 9-11pm and the windows are not double glazed. Luckily they left at 11 but be warned - if someone was having a party in those apartments you would hear it! Overall, great for our purposes and good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: RallyB
Reviews.Content: A friend and I were attending a conference at a nearby hotel and I couldn't have been more pleased with this little hotel. The staff was very friendly, helpful and extremely accomodating. We arrived very early (9AM) and they were happy to check us in. They don't have an elevator, so this was a bit of a pain, but the desk person even helped us with this! They helped us with shuttle services and every other need. Our room was quiet (upper floor), clean and simple. If you're looking for the Ritz, this isn't it--but if you want convenience at a great price---you will love this place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two children (15 and 11) in December as one of our stops on a round the world trip. We were looking for something inexpensive, central and comfortable, and this hotel met all of these criteria. Close to the metro, shops, Hollywood attractions, Universal Studios, and bus routes down Santa Monica Boulevard. The rooms were quite large (we had a suite with 2 large/queen size beds in separate rooms), with a kitchenette. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and would stay again”
Reviews.Author: kateoz
Reviews.Content: Everything was great about the Hollywod Celebrity Hotel. The location is wonderful, 2 minutes walk from Hollywood Boulevard and the Hollywood/Highland complex. Also about 3 minutes walk from the train station, so it's easy to get to Downtown and Union Station. Very helpful desk staff - he gave us bus details to go to Santa Monica and a map. The room (executive king) was large and the bathroom, whilst older, was clean. It also had a table and chairs, as well as 2 armchairs. Great hotel, great location, and I would recommend it to anyone visiting LA.

Reviews.Title: “Footsteps from the footprints”
Reviews.Author: denjules
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights at the begining of January. We stayed in an executive king which is their basic room and it was more than adequate. The rooms are large with a goodside sofa, large bed, small dining table and fridge. There is plenty of hanging space and a nice touch was the vanity/dressing area which really helps as the bathromm isn't that large and I don't think two people could get ready at the same time in such a small space. The furnishings are a bit tired but the rooms are clean and considering the price and the fact you get a breakfast and and a parking space in such a convient location I think you're getting a real great deal.Infact the location is probably the one of it's best feature in just a few steps your inside the hollywood and highland centre which houses various restaurants and shops and from the 2nd level you can see the hollywood sign. Step outside the highland centre and you on the walk of fame and outside the chinese theatre. I would happily recommend this hotel to anyone who is budget conscious but still want the location and room to matter

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Limerick1ady
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location, just behind the Kodak theatre and a subway station. I took a chance booking this hotel as a reviewer mentioned feeling unsafe walking to the hotel at night. We felt safe at all times and met no unsavoury characters. The staff were very friendly and gave us clear directions to Santa Monica (a bit of a trek by bus) and Warner Brothers studios. The breakfast could be improved upon.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK #2...”
Reviews.Author: poussemoussu
Reviews.Content: The rates are great for the location but the hotel has nothing special to write about. The rooms are rooms, the beds are beds, it's clean but there is nothing to catch your attention, neither concerning the decoration of the room nor concerning the amenities. The corridors were no heated and the breakfast was terrible! The steam room was right in the middle of a tiny fitness room: I doubt anyone feels like using it! I did not! To sum up, it's a good place to sleep but that's it!

Reviews.Title: “It's okay”
Reviews.Author: Ednedfred
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Celebrity last week for two nights as I was in town on business. I had read several reviews on this hotel on this site and felt I'd give it a try. Here's my review: The hotel is conventiently located (within walking distance) to many of the Hollywood attractions. Parking is free and wasn't a problem. Check-in took forever. I was the only one checking in and I'll bet it took 15 minutes. My travel agent booked the hotel for me and typically I just have a credit card impression taken for incidentials. The clerk took my credit card and pre-charged the room cost, then took my drivers license and wrote down my license number, etc. Anyway, I got in. The hotel apprears to once have been apartments that have been converted into hotel rooms. As a result, you have a small kitchen in your room and the room is spacious enough. Unfortunately, the room needed some updating. I kind of felt like I was staying in a tired Econo Lodge on the side of the freeway. Other than the room decor, it was nice enough. Free high-speed internet, coffee 24/7 and continental breakfast is included in the rate. Unfortunately it started at 8:00 a.m. and I was out by then. The workout room was pretty lame but there were steambath's if one chose to use. The neighborhood can get pretty rough at night so I couldn't rate this for children. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Celebrity Hollywood Hotel for 2 nights. While the hotel website photos looked really nice, we found the upgrades were only done at the front foyer. The rooms were old. Check out the pictures taken by a reviewer posted on Nov. 12, 2005. They are quite representative of what we saw. On the bright side, the location is excellent; five minutes walking distance to Hollywood Blvd, Kodak Theatre and Mann's Chinese Theatre. Parking was included which was great. Although there's parking for $2.00 an hour for the first 4 hours at the Hollywood and Highland Shopping Centre (next to the Renaissance Hotel). The hotel staff was very helpful, especially Alvin at the front desk. The breakfast was adequate although the coffee was terrible. The room was also average and it had a moldy smell to it. The only thing that really needed improvement was the shower head, we had water trickling the whole time. Overall, we chose this hotel for its location and free parking. The points of interest in LA are pretty spread out so having a car was definitely helpful. We only stayed at this hotel for 2 nights but would probably picked something more comfortable if we planned to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price/Good Location”
Reviews.Author: turkeyroll
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Celebrity from Nov 17-20. We booked the room directly from the hotel and got it for $79/night. The room was clean, very spacious and included a kitchen area. Our room was on the first floor (there are only 2 floors). The room was a bit noisy as you can hear everything in the room above you, including people walking around, so request a room on the 2nd floor. The hotel offers a good continental breakfast with a variety of juices, muffins, croissants & bagels. They offer free use of a computer with internet access in the lobby which is really a nice touch. The parking lot is free, but very small. The hotel is within a 5 minute walk to hollywood blvd, and all the attractions. Overall, like most hotels there are a few kinks, but our stay was a pleasant one.

Reviews.Title: “A nasty bait and switch, with no apologies or refunds.”
Reviews.Author: ekalee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I reserved a room on Expedia for one night at the Hollywood Celebrity based on the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor. When we arrived, the hotel told us that they had a "plumbing problem" and offered us a room at their sister property the Hollywood Liberty Hotel across the street. They told us we could have a room at the Celebrity if we wanted to wait until 10 pm for it. This was not acceptable for us, as we had just driven for seven hours and needed to get ready to go to a party. I took the room they offered at the Liberty out of sheer exhaustion, I wish I had inspected it more closely before I agreed to spend a night in this dump. The halls and rooms smelled like cigarettes- despite the signs indicating that the hotel was non-smoking. What can I say about the room- my attached photos tell most of the story. The heat was a space heater! The shower didn't have hot water until the manager came in and said, "You have to find it..." and then calibrated it just so until a lukewarm trickle came out. The bathroom looked like it had been outfitted on a trip to the Dollar Depot, with a cheap plastic pink tension rod to hold up the shower curtain (actually it was just a liner). The bathmat was a hand towel. The coverlet on the bed was obviously stained and yellowed when we turned it down. The bed had no fitted sheet on it, so within five minutes of lying in it, the sheet was off and we were lying on the mattress. The most disgusting feature of this room was the walls. The walls were heavily stained with and looked as if they were last painted in the Nixon administration. There were cigarette ashes pooled in the windowsill of the bathroom. The biggest affront was that this room was supposedly comparable to the Celebrity. This room made the Super 8 seem like a four star resort by comparison. I never saw any of the rooms at the Celebrity but I can guarantee there was no steam room at the Liberty! I can't believe the owners have the gall to charge more than $40 per night for this place. The most outrageous thing is that Hollywood Celebrity offered no apology, no discount off the room or a free night at a later date, which would have been totally appropriate. They basically told us we could still come over for the continental breakfast at the Celebrity. No effort was made to refund any of my money, even though I had pre-paid a higher rate for the Celebrity. I hate to say it, but the way in which management treated us, I had the sinking feeling that they didnâ€™t really have a plumbing problem, but that they had overbooked and given our room to someone else. Buyers beware! If they offer you a room at the Liberty, politely decline and take your business elsewhereâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - Terrific Location!!”
Reviews.Author: Pharmgrrrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hollywood Celebrity from Nov 2nd-6th, 2005. The rooms were nice and large....everything was really clean. The rooms were not brand new, but everything was in great shape. The lobby area was nice and bright. Everything seemed to sparkle! The front patio was nice to sit and take a break. The beds were comfy and it was a really quiet place to stay - no loud parties while we were there. Probably one of the key sellers for this hotel is location. Just a 5-10 minute walk from the center of everything in Hollywood. Right behind Kodak Theater and Hollywood and Highland. We were even able to cut through the parking lot for Hollywood and Highland and felt completely safe at all times. As some previous posts have indicated - the parking lot is small. We never had a problem getting parking while we were there though. The day we left - we had a flight out at 6am, so we left the hotel in the morning hours. Our car was blocked in - but the front desk guy had all of the keys for the cars blocking ours and had our car unblocked in minutes. One thing i would suggest for improvement in this hotel is more counter space in the bathrooms. That was a bit lacking. We used the window sill for our bathroom items, but there was not much room there. A small shelf was also on the mirror. Another thing that would be beneficial is better lighting in the bathroom/vanity area. It was a bit dim. Oh - and the hairdryer in our room wasn't extremely powerful, but it got the job done. Would definitely stay here again in a minute. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking to be close to what hollywood has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place To Stay In Hollywood”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in October. It was a fabulous place to stay. The room was massive with a king sized bed, dining room with a fridge, dressing room, walk in wardrobe and lovely bathroom. The hotel was lovely - the reception area, hallways adorned with pictures of old Hollywood stars and films. There was free internet access and a continental breakfast was included. The location was fantastic - just minutes walk from the Hollywood sign, Walk of Fame, Mann's Chinese Theatre and Kodak theatre where the Oscars are held. My stay cost Â£200.00 with the current exhnage rate which is fantastic compared to what you'd get in the UK for that price and bear in mind I was there alone but the price would have been the same for two sharing. I don't think I could have found a better hotel - it had a gym and sauna too, which I never got around to using. I would defintely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Foxpd
Reviews.Content: A very nice Hotel. Behind the Kodak teather in a very quiet area. When we arrive the little parking area of the Hotel was full so we had to park in a gasoline station near here. The Hotel paid the park for us. The room was large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't want better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: By this stage we had stayed in over 5 motels across the US and this one by far would have to be the best. Great location (right behing the Kodak Theatre), breakfast in the morning (quality food), the staff were helpful and friendly and the rooms were large and clean. the street the hotel is located on was quiet and pretty and i would recommend this hotel to absolutely anyone. My friend and i were on a budget and although i dont remember the exact price per night i know we were under our budget so it definately wasnt too expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here twice for 2 nights each time and found the place to be perfect the hotel staff were the best we found in california The rooms were large and very clean and they offered a light breakfast in the mornings. There is also free internet access in the front lobby. The hotel also has a small workout room with sauna. The hotels location is excellent we were a 2 minute walk to all of the walk of fame attractions and the metro which is 1 stop from Universal city. A good place to eat is the Pig and Whistle look around for the 15% discount vouchers. We did all 4 city pass attractions the stars homes tour is very average you see more homes where people used to live than where they are living now, its really just a tour of the district. the Entertainment museum was good and also the Kodak theatre was worth seeing. The best one was the Redline walking tour which was very good and worth doing when you very first get there. We went to the Guiness book of records which was good but the wax museum is terrible don't waste your money on this place. I highly recommend staying at the Hollywood Celebrity hotel

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: vegasbaby26
Reviews.Content: I just came back form here after staying 6 nights, The hotel overall was a nice place, good sized room, helpfull and pleasent staff and the breafast muffins are to die for. The location was perfect for those who want to do the whole touristy thing, you can get to hollywood and highland center through the back. The only reason I wouldn't stay here again is because apart from the hollywood and highland the rest of hollywood is pretty shabby, I prefered the west/ho area. But a great hotel, cheap and friendly

HotelInfo.Name: Hollywood Celebrity Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 1775 Orchid Ave, Los Angeles, CA 90028
